title: How can I serve others?
content: Jesus Christ set the perfect example of how to love and serve others. As priesthood holders, we have a duty to serve others. We can serve others as the Savior did in many ways, including administering priesthood ordinances, sharing the gospel with others, and performing simple, everyday acts of kindness.
Think about experiences you have had serving others. What were the results of your service? What experiences could you share that would help the young men feel the importance of service?
When have you seen the young men serving others? What experiences can the young men share with each other? Why is it important to learn how to give Christlike service?
As you study the scriptures and other resources about service, look for things that will inspire the young men to give Christlike service.
(When we serve others, we are serving God)
(We should love others as the Savior loves us)
(Pure religion is to visit the fatherless and widows)
(Attitudes of Nephi and Laman and Lemuel in response to assignments)
(We should be willing to comfort those in need of comfort)

During His earthly ministry, Jesus Christ spent His time serving and helping those around Him. True disciples of Christ do likewise. The Savior said, “By this shall all men know that ye are my disciples, if ye have love one to another” (
). As you teach the young men, look for opportunities to invite them to share how they have served others and what inspired them to give service.
